qas.question: Various cultures have come up with ways of making clothes from what?
Many people still wear clothes that are what shape?
Pins or belts hold what in place?
What precious material may remain uncut?
Different cultures have evolved various ways of making whatever for?

plausible_answers.text: rectangles of cloth wrapped to fit

qas.question: Few people still wear garments made of what?

plausible_answers.text: the dhoti for men and the sari for women

qas.question: Pins are used to hold up what Indian governments

plausible_answers.text: people of various sizes or the same person at different sizes can wear the garment.

qas.question: What are the disadvantage of making clothes from a single rectangular cloth?

context: Different cultures have evolved various ways of creating <b5_0>clothes<b5_0/> out of <a0_0>cloth<a0_0/>. One approach simply involves draping the cloth. Many people wore, and still wear, garments consisting of <a1_0><b6_0>rectangles<a1_0/> of cloth wrapped to fit<b6_0/> – for example, <b7_0>the dhoti for men and the sari for women<b7_0/> in the Indian subcontinent, the <a2_0><b8_0>Scottish<a2_0/> kilt<b8_0/> or the Javanese sarong. The clothes may simply be tied up, as is the case of the first two garments; or pins or belts hold the <a3_0>garments<a3_0/> in place, as in the case of the latter two. The precious <a4_0>cloth<a4_0/> remains uncut, and <b9_0>people of various sizes or the same person at different sizes can wear the garment.
